newsitem.title: JAPAN: Moody's says Japan insurers' credit outlook dims.
newsitem.headline: Moody's says Japan insurers' credit outlook dims.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Wednesday that the deregulation of Japan's insurance industry is dimming the credit quality outlook for Japanese non-life insurance companies.

"As deregulation progresses, increased competitive pressure, and consequently narrowing margins, will have negative ramifications on the entire Japanese property and casualty insurance industry," it said.
Moody's warned that ratings could change over the medium term.

The rating outlooks for Yasuda Fire & Marine Insurance Co Ltd and Mitsui Marine & Fire Insurance Co Ltd are negative, and the rating outlooks for Tokio Marine & Fire Insurance Co Ltd and Sumitomo Marine & Fire Insurance Co Ltd are stable but guarded, Moody's said.
